intro: Synostemon hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy synostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Synostemon hirtellus is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
